page.title: 19Farming 1945,Cortachy
page.content: {We interviewed a retired farmer and {his wife. { }Forty years ago it took 8 workers 3 weeks to clear the fields.Crops were cut with a binder and the stooks carted away and stacked.The travelling threshing mill went round farms all winter.Nowadays the same work could be done in 2 days.Today one man can milk 100 cows in about 2 hours.It used to take the dairyman over 2 hours to milk 30 cows.The farmer sold the milk himself around Cortachy,Kirriemuir and Forfar. At this time the dairyman, assisted by his wife, earned Â£8 a week(Â£100). His house,milk and potatoes were free. Milk was 1.5p a pint(24p),coal 25p a cwt.(Â£5),gent's suit Â£2.50(Â£80) and a pair of shoes 62.5p(Â£20). (1985 figures are shown in brackets.)
